title: Kuma Could Have Saved Bonney Instead of Protecting the Sunny
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Kuma's decision to protect the Thousand Sunny during the two-year timeskip was questionable given his relationship with his daughter Bonney. Based on the Paw-Paw Fruit's abilities to repel abstract concepts like pain, there's speculation that Kuma could have potentially used his powers to save Bonney from her disease instead of dedicating his final act of free will to protecting a ship. This has led to debates about whether this represents a plot hole or demonstrates Kuma's belief that the Straw Hats' journey is more important to the future of the world than his personal family matters.
author: Various One Piece Community Members

title: Kuma's Protection as Part of a Larger Plan
theoryText: The revelation in Episode 523 that Kuma protected the Thousand Sunny suggests he had knowledge of future events or believed in the Straw Hats' critical importance to the world. This theory proposes that Kuma's protection wasn't just a favor but part of a coordinated plan involving Dragon, Vegapunk, and possibly others in the Revolutionary Army. The fact that he specifically programmed this mission before his full conversion to PX-0 indicates premeditation and suggests he knew the Straw Hats would play a crucial role in future events. This connects to larger theories about inherited will and the importance of the D. clan.
author: One Piece Theory Community

title: The Straw Hat's Connection to Roger Through Rayleigh's Reflection
theoryText: Rayleigh's comment in Episode 523 that 'Luffy has taken another step towards becoming a man worthy of that hat he wears' combined with his flashback to meeting Roger suggests a deeper connection than simple mentorship. Some fans theorize that Rayleigh sees Luffy not just as similar to Roger, but as potentially destined to complete what Roger started. The emphasis on the straw hat itself - which belonged to Roger before Shanks gave it to Luffy - may indicate that it carries a significance beyond sentimentality. This theory connects to the idea that certain individuals are 'chosen' by history or fate to carry forward particular dreams and destinies.
author: One Piece Fans
